jfilesyslib

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • jfilesyslib.FileSystem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullFileSystem, MemoryFs, MirrorFs

    public abstract class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Inherit from this class in order to get a basic, minimal file system. There are some non-abstract methods which should be implemented.
    Author:
    Marc Miltenberger

    • Constructor Summary

      FileSystem()

      • listDirectory

        public abstract java.lang.Iterable<EntityInfo> listDirectory(java.lang.String path)
                                                      throws NotADirectoryException,
                                                             PathNotFoundException,
                                                             AccessDeniedException
        Reads a given directory and returns an iterator.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the iterator
        Throws:
        NotADirectoryException - the path is not a directory
        PathNotFoundException - the path could not be found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied

                                    throws PathNotFoundException
        Returns some meta data about the path.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the meta data
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path could not be found

      • rename

        public abstract void rename(java.lang.String source,
          java.lang.String destination)
                     throws PathNotFoundException,
                            DestinationAlreadyExistsException,
                            AccessDeniedException
        Renames a file/directory/symbolic link.
        It is equivalent to moving a file/directory.
        Parameters:
        source - the source path
        destination - the destination path
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the source path or the parent directory of the destination could not be found
        DestinationAlreadyExistsException - the destination already exists
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied

      • openFile

        public abstract FileHandle openFile(java.lang.String file,
                  boolean read,
                  boolean write)
                             throws PathNotFoundException,
                                    AccessDeniedException,
                                    NotAFileException
        Opens a file.
        It is guaranteed that createFile is called first for new files.
        You should not overwrite the file if write is true.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to open
        read - whether the file should be open to read
        write - whether the file should be open to write
        Returns:
        the file handle
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the file was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        NotAFileException - the given path is not a file

      • createFile

        public abstract void createFile(java.lang.String path)
                         throws PathNotFoundException,
                                DestinationAlreadyExistsException,
                                AccessDeniedException
        Creates a new (blank) file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the parent directory could not be found
        DestinationAlreadyExistsException - the destination already exists (regardless whether it is a directory or a file)
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied

      • createDirectory

        public abstract void createDirectory(java.lang.String path)
                              throws PathNotFoundException,
                                     DestinationAlreadyExistsException,
                                     AccessDeniedException
        Creates a new, empty directory.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the new directory
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the parent directory could not be found
        DestinationAlreadyExistsException - the destination already exists (regardless whether it is a directory or a file)
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied

      • read

        public abstract int read(FileHandle handle,
       java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
       long offset)
        Reads from a file.
        Offset specifies the offset within the opened file, not within the buffer.
        The handle is guaranteed to be a valid file handle.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        buffer - the buffer to fill
        offset - the offset within the file
        Returns:
        the number of read bytes

      • setLength

        public abstract void setLength(FileHandle handle,
             long length)
                        throws DriveFullException
        Truncates or lengthens a file.
        The handle is guaranteed to be a valid file handle.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        length - the new file size in bytes
        Throws:
        DriveFullException - there is no more space

      • write

        public abstract void write(FileHandle handle,
         java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
         long offset)
                    throws DriveFullException,
                           PartIsLockedException
        (Over-)writes the buffer into the specified file handle.
        Offset specifies the offset within the opened file, not within the buffer.
        The handle is guaranteed to be a valid file handle.

        Be careful: offset may be larger than the file size!
        In this case you should fill everything in between with zeros.

        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle.
        buffer - the buffer to write
        offset - the offset within the file
        Throws:
        DriveFullException - there is no more space
        PartIsLockedException - the specified range has been locked

      • flush

        public abstract void flush(FileHandle handle)
                    throws DriveFullException
        Should write all pending data in the cache.
        It is not guaranteed that this method is called before close.
        The handle is guaranteed to be a valid file handle.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        Throws:
        DriveFullException - there is no more free space

      • close

        public abstract void close(FileHandle handle)
                    throws DriveFullException
        Closes the file handle.
        The handle is guaranteed to be a valid file handle and not closed yet.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        Throws:
        DriveFullException - there is no more space

                         throws PathNotFoundException,
                                AccessDeniedException
        Deletes a file or symbolic link.
        Parameters:
        file - the file
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the file could not be found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        NotAFileException - the specified path is not a file

      • getTotalBlockCount

        public abstract long getTotalBlockCount()
        Returns the number of total blocks. E.g. a virtual 40 mb hard drive with 1 mb block size has 40 total blocks.
        Returns:
        the number of total blocks

      • getFreeBlockAvailableCount

        public abstract long getFreeBlockAvailableCount()
        Returns the number of free blocks, which are available to the current user.
        In the easiast case:
        Available Free Block Count = Free Block Count
        Returns:
        the number of free blocks

      • createSymbolicLink

        public void createSymbolicLink(java.lang.String source,
                      java.lang.String destination)
                        throws PathNotFoundException,
                               SourceAlreadyExistsException,
                               AccessDeniedException,
                               UnsupportedFeatureException
        Creates a symbolic link at source pointing to destination.
        The default file system does not support this feature.
        Parameters:
        source - the source
        destination - the destination
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the parent directory (of source) could not be found
        SourceAlreadyExistsException - the source does already exist
        AccessDeniedException - the access was denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is unsupported
        See Also:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symbolic_link

      • createHardLink

        public void createHardLink(java.lang.String source,
                  java.lang.String destination)
                    throws PathNotFoundException,
                           SourceAlreadyExistsException,
                           AccessDeniedException,
                           UnsupportedFeatureException
        Creates a hard link at source pointing to destination.
        The default file system does not support this feature.
        Parameters:
        source - the source
        destination - the destination
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the parent directory could not be found
        SourceAlreadyExistsException - the source does already exist
        AccessDeniedException - the access was denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is unsupported
        See Also:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hard_link

      • pathExists

        public boolean pathExists(java.lang.String path)
        Checks whether the path already exists.
        This is done via calling getFileMetaData and catching the PathNotFoundException.
        You should consider to override it with a faster implementation
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        true if path exists

      • getMaxPathLength

        public int getMaxPathLength()
        Returns the maximum path length. The default value is 32768.
        Returns:
        the maximum path length

      • getFilesFreeCount

        public int getFilesFreeCount()
        Returns the number of files which may be created.
        Returns:
        the number of files which may be created

      • getTotalFilesCount

        public int getTotalFilesCount()
        Returns the total number of files on the volume.
        By default it returns 0, but it does not seem to harmful.
        Returns:
        the total number of files

      • setUnixPermissions

        public void setUnixPermissions(java.lang.String path,
                      UnixPermissions perms)
                        throws PathNotFoundException,
                               AccessDeniedException,
                               UnsupportedFeatureException
        Sets the unix permissions for a file/directory.
        This feature is not supported by default.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        perms - the permissions
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is unsupported

                          throws PathNotFoundException,

      • getWindowsAttributes

        public WindowsAttributes getWindowsAttributes(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws PathNotFoundException,
                                              AccessDeniedException,
                                              UnsupportedFeatureException
        Returns the windows attributes.
        The default implementation:
        If the file system is read only, it returns the read only attribute.
        If not, it does not return any attribute.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the windows attributes
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is not supported

      • lockFile

        public void lockFile(FileHandle handle,
            long byteOffset,
            long length)
              throws PathNotFoundException,
                     AccessDeniedException,
                     NotAFileException,
                     UnsupportedFeatureException,
                     AlreadyLockedException
        Locks a file in the specified range for every write access except for the File Handle handle.
        This is windows specific.
        This feature is not supported by default.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        byteOffset - the byte offset
        length - the length
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        NotAFileException - the path is not a file
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is not supported
        AlreadyLockedException - parts of the specified range are already locked

      • unlockFile

        public void unlockFile(FileHandle handle,
              long byteOffset,
              long length)
                throws PathNotFoundException,
                       AccessDeniedException,
                       NotAFileException,
                       UnsupportedFeatureException
        Unlocks a file in the specified range.
        This is windows specific.
        The caller does not perform a check that the file handle is identical to the locker's file handle.
        This feature is not supported by default.
        Parameters:
        handle - the file handle
        byteOffset - the byte offset
        length - the length
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        NotAFileException - the path is not a file
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is not supported

        public int getNumberOfFilesInDirectory(DirectoryInfo info)
        Returns the number of files (and direct subdirectories) in a directory
        Parameters:
        info - the directory info
        Returns:
        the number of files

      • supportsUnicodeFilenames

        public boolean supportsUnicodeFilenames()
        Returns true if the file system supports unicode filenames.
        Since most file systems use Java Strings to encode file names, the default value is true.
        Returns:
        true if the file system supports unicode filenames.

        public boolean isCompressed()
        Returns true if the file system is compressed
        Returns:
        true if the file system is compressed

        public boolean isReadOnly()

      • getExtendedAttribute

        public ExtendedAttribute getExtendedAttribute(java.lang.String path,
                                     java.lang.String name)
                                       throws PathNotFoundException,
                                              AccessDeniedException,
                                              UnsupportedFeatureException,
                                              AttributeNotFoundException
        Returns one specific extended attribute.
        This method does not need to be overriden.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        name - the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        the attribute
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is not supported
        AttributeNotFoundException - the specified attribute was not found

                                                             throws PathNotFoundException,
                                                                    AccessDeniedException,
                                                                    UnsupportedFeatureException
        Lists the extended attributes of a path.
        This feature is not supported by default.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the extended attributes
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - the path was not found
        AccessDeniedException - the access is denied
        UnsupportedFeatureException - the feature is not supported
